meanings.sent1: I need to recopy this document for my records.
meanings.sent2: Please recopy the text to ensure it is legible.
meanings.sent3: After my cat knocked over the papers, I had to recopy them all.
meanings.sent4: Her memory was like a photocopier, able to recopy every detail perfectly.
meanings.sent5: The student had to recopy the entire essay due to a mistake.

meanings.definition: To make a duplicate copy of something
meanings.sent1: She had to recopy the map for each team member.
meanings.sent2: The secretary will recopy the report for distribution.
meanings.sent3: The detective decided to recopy the evidence for safekeeping.
meanings.sent4: The artist's hand trembled as he tried to recopy the masterpiece.
meanings.sent5: The librarian will recopy the old manuscript to preserve it.

meanings.definition: The act of copying something again
meanings.sent1: The recopy of the document was clearer than the original.
meanings.sent2: The teacher requested a recopy of the assignment for better readability.
meanings.sent3: The recopy of the painting revealed hidden details.
meanings.sent4: The recopy of the contract highlighted errors in the first version.
meanings.sent5: The recopy of the recipe made it easier to follow.
